sentences.sContent: The monarch was ousted by a military coup.
sentences.sContent_eng: The monarch was ousted by a military coup.
sentences.sCn: 那君主被军事政变者废黜了。

sentences.sContent: While 64% think the monarch should retire, only 31% do not.
sentences.sContent_eng: While 64% think the monarch should retire, only 31% do not.
sentences.sCn: 64%的人认为君主应该退休，只有31%的人表示反对。

sentences.sContent: Country is governed by an elected legislature and prime minister, with a monarch as a symbolic head of state.
sentences.sContent_eng: Country is governed by an elected legislature and prime minister, with a monarch as a symbolic head of state.
sentences.sCn: 国家由选举产生的立法机关和首相治理，由一个君主作为国家的象征性领袖。

remMethod.val: mon(单个的) + arch(统治者) → 最高统治者 → 君主
